<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/22/news-outlets-adjust-life-trump?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
News Outlets' Post-Trump Hangover
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Newspaper getting thrown away" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80NDczL29sZF9uZXdzLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If you haven’t felt the itch to check Twitter 24/7, skim your <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">preferred news site</a>, or keep cable news humming in the background since President Trump left office, join the club. A few months into the new Biden administration, news consumption has significantly <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/lifestyle/media/media-trump-bump-slump/2021/03/22/5f13549a-85d1-11eb-bfdf-4d36dab83a6d_story.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">declined</a>, according to the Washington Post. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">TV:</strong></span><span> CNN lost almost half of its primetime viewership in the key 25–54 demographic in the period between President Biden's inauguration and March 15. </span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Online: </strong></span><span>From January to February, unique visitors to the NYT's website dropped 17%, while the Washington Post clocked in a 26% decline over the period, per audience tracking firm ComScore.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Trump’s dramatic time in office was like San Francisco in 1849 for media companies that covered politics. The NYT started his presidency with 3 million paying subscribers and ended it with 7.5 million. CNN had its <a href="https://cnnpressroom.blogs.cnn.com/2020/12/16/2020-is-cnns-best-year-ever/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">best year ever</a> in 2020 and drew more viewers aged 25–54 than Fox for the first time in 19 years in Q4. Throw in the onset of a global pandemic and door-busting subscription deals, and news companies were inundated with traffic. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">But now, strategies are shifting </h2>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The NYT warned last November that its subscriber gains would start to slow once No. 45 left office. Now, it’s </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/features/2021-03-18/new-york-times-games-spelling-bee-the-mini-offset-news-slowdown?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">investing more resources</a></span><span> into its Games and Cooking divisions in order to push beyond news content into more anchovy content.   </span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The Washington Post is going the opposite route. It's bringing on 150 new employees in the outlet's biggest hiring spree ever, pushing its newsroom to well over 1,000. It plans to use the extra bodies to expand reporting on issues of race and international news.  </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>With DC going from <em>House of Cards </em>to C-SPAN 2, the focus is shifting from filibusters to stonks. Politics consumption on major new sites dropped 28% from January to February, according to analytics company SimilarWeb, but interest in business and finance news only slightly declined over the same period.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FINANCE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/22/leon-black-steps-jeffrey-epstein-ties?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Leon Black Steps Down
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Leon Black, cofounder of investment juggernaut Apollo Global Management, has <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-apollo-global-clayton/leon-black-leaves-apollo-executive-roles-after-epstein-investigation-idUSKBN2BE1E0?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">stepped down</a> as chairman following an independent investigation into his ties with Jeffrey Epstein. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What happened:</strong> Over a five-year period, Black paid Epstein $158 million for advisory services, including tax and estate planning. While Black was cleared of wrongdoing, the optics around his relationship with an accused sex trafficker didn't look...great. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Black was already stepping down as CEO, and his replacement and fellow cofounder, Marc Rowan, has assumed the position early. Former SEC head Jay Clayton replaces Black as non-executive chairman. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">For Black, it's more of a "cya l8r." With an 18% stake, he's still Apollo's largest shareholder and plans to return to the company.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What's Apollo? </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Just one of Wall Street's most successful private equity firms, with $455 billion in assets.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Like Berkshire Hathaway in 2008, Apollo recently <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/5b1a1c63-5920-4876-829f-e3f1552a3903?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">cemented</a> its reputation as "responder of last resort," the FT reports. The firm has helped companies including Hertz, United, and Expedia weather pandemic-era financial troubles.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>This leadership shuffle comes during a larger transition as Apollo <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-03-08/apollo-to-merge-with-insurance-firm-athene-in-11-billion-deal?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">acquires</a> insurance giant Athene Holding. The deal will give Apollo even more $$$ to pour into investments. </p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
WEALTH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/22/irs-researchers-wealthiest-1-didnt-disclose-21-income-irs?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
If You Can Dodge a Wrench, You Can Dodge Taxes
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/22/irs-researchers-wealthiest-1-didnt-disclose-21-income-irs" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="tax forms" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80MDI0L3RheF9mb3Jtcy5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Getty</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The wealthiest 1% of US households <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/high-income-tax-avoidance-far-larger-than-thought-new-paper-estimates-11616364001?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">fail to disclose</a> 21% of their income, according to a new study by IRS researchers and economists.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What's going on: </strong>Some types of income, like wages, are automatically reported to the IRS. But other income streams can slip by the agency's auditors with "sophisticated" strategies including...</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Offshore accounts, </strong></span><span>which helped the top 1% evade an estimated $15 billion in taxes. </span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Pass-through businesses</strong></span><span>, like LLCs and partnerships, that are popular with family firms, investment funds, and real estate businesses. They're perfectly legal, but since their income isn't taxed at the corporate rate, it’s easier to hide, and some politicians want to </span><span><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/15/biden-expected-propose-first-major-tax-hike-since-1993?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">raise taxes</a></span><span> on those companies.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Enforcement also isn't what it used to be.<strong style="color:#000"> </strong>Audit rates have slipped over the last decade as the IRS lost 15,000 staffers. The agency's commissioner, Charles Rettig, asked Congress for more funds, arguing every $1 spent on enforcement returns $5–$7.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Collecting unpaid income taxes from the 1% could bring $175 billion into the Treasury annually, the study concludes.</p>

<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>Almost half (49%) of American adults <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/03/21/coping-with-fear-anxiety-about-returning-to-pre-pandemic-life.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">feel uneasy</a> about resuming in-person interactions after the pandemic winds down, according to a new survey from the American Psychological Association.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote:</strong> "The basic property and task for a central bank and central-bank currency is to provide stability in the value of money and in the system, and that is not done by bitcoin."</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Norway's central bank governor <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-03-22/as-norway-tops-cashless-ranks-bitcoin-dubbed-far-too-costly?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">told Bloomberg</a> that he'd never consider swapping out the country's currency for bitcoin. Apparently it was International Central Bankers Bashing Bitcoin Day yesterday, because Fed Chair Jerome Powell also said crypto is "not really useful as a store of value."</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>Meet the 61-year-old Dutch guy behind those crazy wellness routines adopted by athletes and entrepreneurs. (<a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/an-extreme-method-for-stress-management-pushes-for-the-mainstream-11616414402?mod=hp_listc_pos1&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">WSJ</a>)</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MARKETING
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/22/brands-go-allin-covid19-vaccination-promos?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Donut Fear, Krispy Kreme Is Here
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="simpsons donut" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=402 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/N04Fkkzhf9slO/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="simpsons donut" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/N04Fkkzhf9slO/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">While Krispy Kreme probably isn't the first company you think of when you read the words "public health," the donut maker is putting its hydrogenated soybean oil to good use with a <a href="https://www.cbsnews.com/news/krispy-kreme-free-doughnut-every-day-2021-covid-19-vaccination-card/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">creative promo</a>: Anyone who shows a vaccine card at a participating Krispy Kreme gets a free glazed donut.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The "best" part? </strong>The offer is valid until the end of 2021, so a vaccinated person could theoretically obtain a free glazed donut every day for the next 284 days. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Vaccine promos are everywhere</h2>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>A brewery in Cleveland is </span><span><a href="https://www.cleveland.com/entertainment/2021/03/beer-and-the-shot-vaccine-promo-offered-at-market-garden-brewery.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">offering</a></span><span> 10-cent beers to the first 2,021 people who show proof of vaccination through its "Beer and the Shot" promo. </span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Uber and Lyft have been providing free and discounted rides to and from vaccine sites.</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>A luxury hotel in Dubai is offering 25% discounts to fully vaccinated UAE residents. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line:</strong> Brands have struggled to strike the right tone throughout the pandemic. But supporting the vaccine rollout so everyone can return to normal life is like saying you love fluffy corgis—not particularly controversial.</p>

style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nMEDIA \n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nNews Outlets' Post-Trump Hangover\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Newspaper getting thrown away\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80NDczL29sZF9uZXdzLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIf you haven’t felt the itch to check Twitter 24/7, skim your \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epreferred news site\u003c/a\u003e, or keep cable news humming in the background since President Trump left office, join the club. A few months into the new Biden administration, news consumption has significantly \u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/lifestyle/media/media-trump-bump-slump/2021/03/22/5f13549a-85d1-11eb-bfdf-4d36dab83a6d_story.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edeclined\u003c/a\u003e, according to the Washington Post. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eTV:\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e CNN lost almost half of its primetime viewership in the key 25–54 demographic in the period between President Biden's inauguration and March 15. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eOnline: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eFrom January to February, unique visitors to the NYT's website dropped 17%, while the Washington Post clocked in a 26% decline over the period, per audience tracking firm ComScore.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTrump’s dramatic time in office was like San Francisco in 1849 for media companies that covered politics. The NYT started his presidency with 3 million paying subscribers and ended it with 7.5 million. CNN had its \u003ca href=\"https://cnnpressroom.blogs.cnn.com/2020/12/16/2020-is-cnns-best-year-ever/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebest year ever\u003c/a\u003e in 2020 and drew more viewers aged 25–54 than Fox for the first time in 19 years in Q4. Throw in the onset of a global pandemic and door-busting subscription deals, and news companies were inundated with traffic. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eBut now, strategies are shifting \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe NYT warned last November that its subscriber gains would start to slow once No. 45 left office. Now, it’s \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/features/2021-03-18/new-york-times-games-spelling-bee-the-mini-offset-news-slowdown?sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003einvesting more resources\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e into its Games and Cooking divisions in order to push beyond news content into more anchovy content.   \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe Washington Post is going the opposite route. It's bringing on 150 new employees in the outlet's biggest hiring spree ever, pushing its newsroom to well over 1,000. It plans to use the extra bodies to expand reporting on issues of race and international news.  \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eWith DC going from \u003cem\u003eHouse of Cards \u003c/em\u003eto C-SPAN 2, the focus is shifting from filibusters to stonks. Politics consumption on major new sites dropped 28% from January to February, according to analytics company SimilarWeb, but interest in business and finance news only slightly declined over the same period.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd Down\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLeon Black, cofounder of investment juggernaut Apollo Global Management, has \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-apollo-global-clayton/leon-black-leaves-apollo-executive-roles-after-epstein-investigation-idUSKBN2BE1E0?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003estepped down\u003c/a\u003e as chairman following an independent investigation into his ties with Jeffrey Epstein. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat happened:\u003c/strong\u003e Over a five-year period, Black paid Epstein $158 million for advisory services, including tax and estate planning. While Black was cleared of wrongdoing, the optics around his relationship with an accused sex trafficker didn't look...great. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBlack was already stepping down as CEO, and his replacement and fellow cofounder, Marc Rowan, has assumed the position early. Former SEC head Jay Clayton replaces Black as non-executive chairman. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFor Black, it's more of a \"cya l8r.\" With an 18% stake, he's still Apollo's largest shareholder and plans to return to the company.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhat's Apollo? \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eJust one of Wall Street's most successful private equity firms, with $455 billion in assets.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLike Berkshire Hathaway in 2008, Apollo recently \u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/5b1a1c63-5920-4876-829f-e3f1552a3903?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecemented\u003c/a\u003e its reputation as \"responder of last resort,\" the FT reports. The firm has helped companies including Hertz, United, and Expedia weather pandemic-era financial troubles.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eThis leadership shuffle comes during a larger transition as Apollo \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-03-08/apollo-to-merge-with-insurance-firm-athene-in-11-billion-deal?sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eacquires\u003c/a\u003e insurance giant Athene Holding. The deal will give Apollo even more $$$ to pour into investments. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe wealthiest 1% of US households \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/high-income-tax-avoidance-far-larger-than-thought-new-paper-estimates-11616364001?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efail to disclose\u003c/a\u003e 21% of their income, according to a new study by IRS researchers and economists.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat's going on: \u003c/strong\u003eSome types of income, like wages, are automatically reported to the IRS. But other income streams can slip by the agency's auditors with \"sophisticated\" strategies including...\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eOffshore accounts, \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003ewhich helped the top 1% evade an estimated $15 billion in taxes. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003ePass-through businesses\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, like LLCs and partnerships, that are popular with family firms, investment funds, and real estate businesses. They're perfectly legal, but since their income isn't taxed at the corporate rate, it’s easier to hide, and some politicians want to \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/15/biden-expected-propose-first-major-tax-hike-since-1993?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eraise taxes\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e on those companies.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eEnforcement also isn't what it used to be.\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e \u003c/strong\u003eAudit rates have slipped over the last decade as the IRS lost 15,000 staffers. The agency's commissioner, Charles Rettig, asked Congress for more funds, arguing every $1 spent on enforcement returns $5–$7.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp
